intro: Peucedanum kirungae, commonly known as the Kirungae angelica, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and forested areas, thriving in cool and moist climates. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
